intro: Thesium angulosum, commonly known as the angular thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which is closely related to the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas with a Mediterranean climate. Thesium angulosum is typically perennial and produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind.
